meanings.definition: The belief or doctrine that complex systems cannot be fully understood by breaking them down into their individual parts.
meanings.sent1: Antireductionism challenges the idea of simplifying complex things.
meanings.sent2: Scientists who support antireductionism argue against oversimplification.
meanings.sent3: The debate on antireductionism can get quite intense in academic circles.
meanings.sent4: In a world of antireductionism, every piece contributes to the whole like a puzzle.
meanings.sent5: Understanding antireductionism is like appreciating a beautiful mosaic of ideas.

meanings.definition: The opposition to the reduction of complex phenomena to simpler explanations.
meanings.sent1: Some researchers advocate for antireductionism to preserve the complexity of nature.
meanings.sent2: Antireductionism emphasizes the richness of intricate explanations over simplistic ones.
meanings.sent3: The concept of antireductionism can lead to fascinating discussions among scholars.
meanings.sent4: In a world of antireductionism, every detail holds its own significance.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of antireductionism lies in embracing the depth of complex phenomena.
